title: Johnny Hodges - Storyville Masters Of Jazz (1943-64)
description:
JOHNNY HODGES - STORYVILLE MASTERS OF JAZZ

1. Don't Get Around Much Anymore

Ray Nance, Rex Stewart, Harold Baker, Wallace Jones (tp), Lawrence Brown, Joseph Nanton, Juan Tizol (tb), Johnny Hodges, Sax Mallard (as), Chancey Haughton (cl), Ben Webster (ts), Harry Carney (bs & bcl), Duke Ellington (p), Fred Guy (g), Alvin "Junior" Raglin (b), Sonny Greer (d)
Recorded live at the Hurricane, New York, April 3, 1943

2. Passion Flower

Shelton Hemphill, Al Killian, Francis Williams, Harold Baker, Ray Nance (tp), Lawrence Brown, Quentin Jackson, Tyree Glenn (tb), Jimmy Hamilton, Ben Webster (ts), Johnny Hodges, Russell Procope (as), Harry Carney (bs), Billy Strayhorn (p), Wendell Marshall (b), Sonny Greer (d)
Recorded live at the Hollywood Empire, Los Angeles, February, 1949

3. Perdido
4. All Of Me
5. C Jam Blues
6. I Got It Bad And That Ain't Good

Johnny Hodges (as), Al Waslon (p), Joe Schalz (b), Ed Knil (d) 
Recorded in Columbia, Ohio (date unknown)

7. In A Mellotone

Johnny Hodges (as), Shorty Baker (tp), Lawrence Brown (tb), John Coltrane (ts)
Remaining personnel and date unknown

8. Cambridge Blues
9. Brute's Roots
10. Bouncing With Ben
11. One For The Duke
12. Walking The Frog
13. Rabbit Pie

Johnny Hodges (as), Ben Webster (ts), Lou Levy (p), Herb Ellis (g), Wilfred Middlebrooks (b), Gus Johnson (d)
Recorded November 22-23, 1960 at the Jazz Cellar, San Francisco

14. On The Sunny Side Of The Street
15. Good Queen Bess
16. The Jeep Is Jumpin'
17. Things Ain't What They Used To Be

Johnny Hodges (as), Harry Carney (bs), Ray Nance (tp), Lawrence Bown (tb), Al Williams (p), Aaron Bell (b), Sam Woodyard (d)
Recorded March 14, 1961, Stockholm

18. Jeep's Blues
19. Dooji Wooji

Johnny Hodges (as), Cat Anderson (tp), Lawrence Brown (tb), Paul Gonsalves (ts), Russell Procope (as & cl), Victor Feldman (p), George Catlett (b), Sam Woodyard (d)
Recorded August 27, 1964

2006 Storyville Records
